name: Chinatown Heritage Centre, Singapore
description: Experience how Singapore’s early Chinese migrants once lived and learn more about local Chinese culture at the Chinatown Heritage Centre. At the Chinatown Heritage Centre, experience how Singapore’s early Chinese migrants once lived and learn more about local Chinese culture.

name: Thian Hock Keng Temple, Singapore
description: Beautifully restored, Thian Hock Keng Temple is the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea. Thian Hock Keng Temple is the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and dedicated to Mazu, the Goddess of the Sea.

name: Eurasian Heritage Centre: Singapore Attraction
description: This engaging heritage attraction takes you through the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore. This engaging heritage attraction takes you through the history and culture of the Eurasian community in Singapore.

name: Shophouses
description: With many beautifully preserved examples on hand today, the shophouses in Singapore are prime examples of timeless architectural appeal. Few buildings epitomise our culture as fully as the shophouse, with its surprisingly harmonious mix of diverse design elements.

name: Pinnacle@Duxton
description: The soaring lines and stunning views of majestic residential estate Pinnacle at Duxton will make you forget your fear of heights. Almost. With its lofty towers and dizzying sky gardens, the Pinnacle at Duxton takes residential living to soaring new heights.

name: Hajjah Fatimah Mosque
description: The Hajjah Fatimah Mosque will captivate you with its intriguing blend of cross-cultural architectural influences. With its tilting European-style minaret and Chinese tiling, the Hajjah Fatimah Mosque is one of the most unique mosques in Singapore.

name: Haw Par Villa: Singapore Theme Park
description: Embark on an unforgettable journey into Chinese folklore and mythology at the Haw Par Villa theme park. A visit to the Haw Par Villa theme park is an unforgettable journey into Chinese folklore and mythology.

name: NUS Baba House - Singapore Peranakan Architecture
description: This heritage house lends rich insight into Singapore's Peranakan community, thanks to beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts. NUS Baba House is a heritage house that gives a rich look at Singapore's Peranakan community, thanks to beautifully preserved architecture and artefacts.

name: Hong San See Temple Singapore
description: Restored by expert craftsmen from China, the Hong San See temple has been brought back to its full glory. Dancing dragons and prancing phoenixes are just some of the visual delights to catch at the exquisitely restored Hong San See temple.

name: Capitol Building Singapore
description: The queen of Singapore cinemas will soon reclaim her crown as the premier entertainment hub when Capitol Building reopens next year. Now undergoing massive restoration works, Capitol Building will emerge as Singapore’s premier entertainment hub next year.

name: Esplanade Theatre
description: This boldly designed performing arts centre has become a memorable part of Singapore’s skyline. The Esplanade is boldly designed performing arts centre that has become a memorable part of Singapore’s skyline.

name: Gardens by the Bay
description: The lush and beautiful Gardens by the Bay is dominated by the sleekly sculptured biodomes – marvels of architecture, design and engineering. Biodomes, baobabs and the blossoming bounty of every conceivable plant will bowl you over at Gardens by the Bay.

name: The Interlace
description: There’s more than meets the eye in The Interlace’s artful arrangement of residential blocks. Few buildings demonstrate out-of-the-box thinking as well as The Interlace, an intriguingly designed residential complex.

name: PARKROYAL on Pickering
description: PARKROYAL on Pickering is a luxurious garden oasis in downtown Singapore. PARKROYAL on Pickering is a luxurious garden oasis in downtown Singapore.

name: Lasalle College of the Arts
description: How can something that fits so perfectly into a cityscape evoke nature as well? It all lies in the design of Lasalle College of the Arts. Lasalle College of the Arts evokes awe with its bold, graphic lines and stunning reinterpretation of nature.

name: Old Supreme Court Singapore
description: From dispensing justice to displaying art, the Old Supreme Court undergoes an overhaul for its new role as the National Gallery Singapore. Due to reopen as the National Gallery Singapore, the Old Supreme Court is in itself a masterpiece of classical art.

name: SIT Flats Singapore
description: Take a walk back in time through the Art Deco architecture in the heritage neighbourhood of Tiong Bahru. The Art Deco elegance of the flats in Tiong Bahru speak of the richness of a vanished world.
address: Seng Poh Road and Tiong Bahru Road

name: Lau Pa Sat Singapore
description: The grande dame of markets in Singapore, Lau Pa Sat blends history, striking architecture and scrumptious local food into one heady experience. The historic market Lau Pa Sat offers a winning combination of graceful colonial architecture, a longstanding heritage and delicious food.

name: Malay Heritage Centre, Singapore
description: The Malay Heritage Centre is a must-visit if you’re keen on learning about the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community. The Malay Heritage Centre is a must-visit if you’re keen on learning about the rich heritage and culture of Singapore’s Malay community.

name: Peranakan Museum Singapore: History & Culture
description: Get to know Singapore’s vibrant Peranakan community and history at this top-notch museum, filled with fine artefacts and fun exhibits. At the Peranakan Museum, get to know Singapore’s vibrant Peranakan community and its eclectic culture and history with fun and interactive exhibits.

name: Raffles Singapore
description: Hark back to a golden age of elegant refinement and gracious living at Raffles Singapore, where the past reawakens to glorious life. Sip a Singapore Sling beneath the whirling fans at the Long Bar, and let the tranquil charms of Raffles Singapore bring you back into another era.

name: Gillman Barracks – YourSingapore
description: A former British military camp is now Asia's new Destination for Contemporary Art. Gillman Barracks Singapore is Asia’s vibrant new destination for the creation, exhibition and discussion of contemporary art.

name: National Museum of Singapore
description: Singapore’s oldest museum is a progressive showcase of the country’s history and culture. The National Museum of Singapore is a progressive showcase of the country’s history and culture.

name: The Japanese Cemetery Park
description: Located in Hougang, this is the largest Japanese cemetery in Southeast Asia and the burial ground of Singapore’s early Japanese community. The Japanese Cemetery Park is the largest Japanese cemetery in Southeast Asia, containing nearly 1,000 graves of Singapore’s early Japanese community.

name: Dalhousie Obelisk, a Singapore Landmark
description: Dalhousie Obelisk at Empress Place is a famous architectural landmark in Singapore. Dalhousie Obelisk at Empress Place is a famous architectural landmark in Singapore.

name: Raffles Statue – Sir Stamford Raffles Landing Site
description: The sculpture depicts Sir Stamford Raffles, founder of modern Singapore. Two statues exist, at the Raffles Landing Site and Empress Place. Raffles Statue depicts the founder of modern Singapore, Sir Stamford Raffles. Two statues exist today, at the Raffles Landing Site and Empress Place.

name: Singapore Philatelic Museum
description: The Singapore Philatelic Museum offers windows into Singapore and the world through stamps. The Philatelic Museum offers visitors postage stamp-sized windows into Singapore and the rest of the world.

name: Lim Bo Seng Memorial
description: This gazetted national monument at Esplanade Park commemorates one of Singapore’s heroes from World War II. The gazetted Lim Bo Seng Memorial at Esplanade Park commemorates one of Singapore’s heroes from World War II.

name: Kranji War Memorial Landmark in Singapore
description: The Kranji War Memorial in Singapore honours the men and women from the Commonwealth who died in the line of duty during World War II. The Kranji War Memorial in Singapore honours the men and women from the Commonwealth who died in the line of duty during World War II.

name: Indian National Army (INA) Monument in Singapore
description: This marker at Esplanade Park was one of the eleven World War II markers erected in 1995 to commemorate the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II. The Indian National Army (INA) Monument at Esplanade Park is a memorial that was built in 1995 to mark the 50th anniversary of the end of World War II.

name: Reflections at Bukit Chandu: Singapore War Memorial
description: This heritage centre relives the Battle of Pasir Panjang, one of the fiercest battles fought against the Japanese in Singapore during World War II. Reflections at Bukit Chandu relives the Battle of Pasir Panjang, one of the fiercest battles fought against the Japanese in Singapore during World War II.

name: The Cenotaph - a Singapore War Memorial Landmark
description: This war memorial in Esplanade Park honours the heroes who fought and died during World War I and World War II. The Cenotaph in Singapore is a war memorial in Esplanade Park that honours the heroes who fought and died during World War I and World War II.

name: The Civilian War Memorial park in Singapore
description: Situated at the War Memorial Park in Beach Road, this memorial commemorates civilian victims of the Japanese Occupation in Singapore. The Civilian War Memorial and park in Beach Road commemorates Singapore’s civilian victims of the Japanese Occupation during World War II.
address: Bras Basah Road & Beach Road intersection

name: Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple: Hindu Temple in Singapore
description: Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple is one of Singapore’s oldest Hindu temples, in the heart of Little India. Sri Veeramakaliamman Temple is one of Singapore’s oldest Hindu temples, in the heart of Little India.

name: Maghain Aboth Synagogue
description: The Maghain Aboth Synagogue is a gem in more ways than one, providing both a snapshot of history and a glimpse into a rich culture. The simple exterior of the Maghain Aboth Synagogue gives no indication of its richly elegant interiors.

name: Sultan Mosque (Masjid Sultan) Singapore
description: Also known as Masjid Sultan, the impressive Sultan Mosque in historic Kampong Glam is the focal point for Singapore’s Muslim community. The impressive Sultan Mosque (also known as Masjid Sultan) in historic Kampong Glam is the focal point for Singapore’s Muslim community.

name: Sri Mariamman Temple: Hindu Temple in Singapore
description: Located in Chinatown, the Sri Mariamman Temple dates back to 1827 and is the oldest Hindu temple in Singapore. Sri Mariamman Temple, located in Chinatown, is the oldest Hindu temple in Singapore.

name: Armenian Church in Singapore
description: The oldest Christian church in Singapore is an architectural masterpiece from the early 19th century. The Armenian Church is the oldest Christian church in Singapore and an architectural masterpiece from the early 19th century.

name: CHIJMES Singapore
description: Whether functioning as a school or a lifestyle and entertainment complex, it appears the beauty of CHIJMES is only equalled by its versatility. Who would have thought a former school would make such a graceful transition? As a lifestyle and entertainment complex, CHIJMES soars high above the rest.

name: St Andrew’s Cathedral- Singapore Architecture Landmark
description: Singapore's largest cathedral is a stellar example of colonial-era architecture and heritage. St Andrew's Cathedral is Singapore's largest cathedral and a stellar example of colonial-era architecture and heritage.

name: ArtScience Museum Singapore
description: Catch world-class touring exhibitions at this premier exhibition space. Catch world-class touring exhibitions at the ArtScience Museum at Marina Bay Sands.

name: Old Ford Factory Singapore Museum
description: The Old Ford Factory holds an archive of memories about Singapore's wartime occupation by the Japanese. The Old Ford Factory is a repository of memories about the hardships endured during the Japanese Occupation of Singapore.

name: Singapore Coins and Notes Museum & Museum Singapore
description: The rare collection of currencies on display here tells Singapore’s story through the money it has used over the years. The Singapore Coins and Notes Museum tells the story of Singapore through the currencies it has used over the years.

name: Singapore City Gallery
description: The Singapore City Gallery tells the story of the city’s physical transformation. The Singapore City Gallery tells the story of the city’s physical transformation.

name: Changi Museum Singapore
description: Changi Museum provides an emotional exploration of Singapore’s wartime history during the Japanese Occupation. Changi Museum provides an emotional exploration of Singapore’s wartime history during the Japanese Occupation.

name: MINT Museum of Toys Singapore & Toy Museum
description: This toy museum will delight both adults and kids with the vast collection of vintage toys and memorabilia from around the world. Singapore's MINT Museum of Toys' vast collection of vintage toys will delight both kids and adults.

name: Chinese Heritage Centre, Singapore
description: The Chinese Heritage Centre in Singapore is where you can find out more about overseas Chinese communities and their culture. The Chinese Heritage Centre in Singapore is where you can find out more about overseas Chinese communities and their culture.

name: Kampong Glam & Malay Culture in Singapore
description: Discover Kampong Glam's rich history, living traditions, excellent eateries and trendy shops in this vibrant neighbourhood. Discover the heart of Singapore’s Malay community, living traditions, excellent eateries and trendy shops in vibrant Kampong Glam.

name: Contemporary Arts Center
description: This university arts research centre explores contemporary art through exhibitions, public programmes, residencies and research programmes. The Contemporary Arts Center at the Nanyang Technological University uses a variety of medium to explore contemporary art.

name: The Substation, Singapore Contemporary Art Centre
description: This experimental arts centre gives a space for contemporary artists to try out new concepts. The Substation is an experimental arts centre that gives a space for contemporary artists to try out new concepts.

name: Red Dot Design Museum, Singapore
description: This museum holds more than 1,000 award-winning products, communications and concepts that will delight design fans. The Red Dot Design Museum holds more than 1,000 products and items that are winners for their good design.

name: Singapore Art Museum
description: Singapore Art Museum is Singapore’s contemporary art museum, focused on Southeast Asian contemporary art. The Singapore Art Museum houses the world’s largest public collection of contemporary Southeast Asian artworks.

name: Esplanade Theatres on the Bay
description: Catch a non-stop line-up of world-class performances at Singapore’s premier arts centre. Esplanade Theatres on the Bay is the country’s premier arts centre as well as an iconic landmark on the city’s skyline.

name: National Design Centre, Singapore
description: The National Design Centre is the nexus for all things design. It hosts design exhibitions, events and programmes that will quicken the pulse of design lovers. The National Design Centre is a design lover’s dream destination.

name: Victoria Theatre Singapore
description: After a four-year refurbishment, the Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall has since reopened, with its first official concert held there in August 2014. The historic Victoria Theatre and Concert Hall has been transformed to meet the needs of a modern audience.

name: NUS University Museum, Singapore
description: Get a deeper insight into Asian art and artefacts at this museum on the campus of the National University of Singapore. Get a deeper insight into Asian art and artefacts at NUS Museum at Singapore’s leading university.
address: 50 Kent Ridge Crescent, National University of Singapore

name: Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall
description: This revamped museum is a fitting tribute to the intriguing life and times of Chinese revolutionary leader Dr Sun Yat Sen. The Sun Yat Sen Memorial Hall is a fitting tribute to the intriguing life and times of Chinese revolutionary leader Dr Sun Yat Sen.

name: Asian Civilisations Museum & Singapore Museum
description: Housed in a historical building by the Singapore River, this museum tells the stories of Asian civilisations through its permanent collections. Housed in a historical building by the Singapore River, this museum is a microcosm of Asian civilisations spread over 11 galleries.

name: Singapore Botanic Gardens
description: Singapore’s oldest garden is a treasure trove for plant lovers, or those who simply want to have a good time outdoors. Singapore’s Botanic Gardens is a treasure trove for plant lovers, or those who simply want to have a good time outdoors.

name: Singapore Zoo: Attractions & Things to Do
description: Singapore’s zoo is a beautiful, award-winning wildlife park, where animals can roam freely in their natural habitats. Catch animals in their natural habitats at the award-winning Singapore Zoo.

name: River Safari Singapore
description: At the River Safari Singapore, meet manatees and monkeys, piranhas and pandas, as they congregate in and around the park’s waters. The River Safari Singapore is a fascinating new wildlife park that recreates life in and around the world’s rivers.

name: Cable Car Singapore & Mount Faber
description: Getting to this hilltop dining and entertainment spot at Mount Faber by cable car  is half the fun. Getting to the hilltop dining and entertainment spot at Mount Faber by cable car is half the fun.

name: Night Safari, Singapore
description: Instead of going to a club, pop into another popular nightspot, the Night Safari, and mingle with a different crowd of animals at this special zoo. Head to the Night Safari for an after dark visit to the weird and wonderful creatures of the night.

name: Pulau Ubin & Singapore Islands
description: Gravel roads, lush forests and abundant wildlife – Pulau Ubin is a living showcase of what Singapore was like in the 1960s. Hop on a bumboat to the island of Pulau Ubin if you want a taste of nature and rustic village life, away from the hustle and bustle of Singapore.

name: Little India Singapore: History & Culture
description: Little India is a buzzing historic area that shows off the best of Singapore’s Indian community from vibrant culture to incredible shopping. Little India is a buzzing historic district that shows off the best of Singapore’s Indian community, from vibrant culture to ethnic-inspired shopping.

name: Orchard Road, Singapore: Asia's Most Famous Shopping Street
description: Orchard Road, Asia’s most famous shopping street, is home to fashion favourites, specialist stores and loads of other lifestyle choices. Don’t miss a trip to Orchard Road. Asia’s most famous shopping street is home to fashion favourites, specialist stores and loads of other lifestyle choices.

name: MacRitchie Singapore & Singapore Nature Reserve
description: The attractions around MacRitchie Reservoir is a playground of nature for those who love the outdoors. The attractions around MacRitchie Reservoir caters to fitness fanatics, water sports enthusiasts and nature lovers.

name: Gardens by the Bay
description: This sprawling garden in the city provides mesmerising waterfront views across three gardens, spanning over 101 hectares of reclaimed land. Gardens by the Bay provides mesmerising waterfront views across three gardens, spanning over 101 hectares of reclaimed land.

name: Civic District, Singapore
description: The Civic District is where Singapore’s historical, architectural and cultural heritage started. The Civic District is where Singapore’s historical, architectural and cultural heritage starts.

name: HarbourFront, Singapore
description: HarbourFront is the place to go if you're hopping on a cruise from Singapore, taking a regional ferry or simply want to eat, shop or relax. HarbourFront is the place to go if you're hopping on a cruise from Singapore, taking a ferry to the outlying islands or simply want to eat, shop or relax.

name: Bras Basah.Bugis, Singapore Cultural District
description: The Bras Basah.Bugis Precinct is the arts and heritage district in Singapore's civic centre, and home to museums and monuments. The Bras Basah.Bugis Precinct is the vibrant arts and cultural district in the heart of Singapore's civic centre, and home to top museums and monuments.

name: SAM at 8Q & Singapore Art Museum
description: An extension of the Singapore Art Museum, SAM at 8Q features contemporary art exhibitions and is home to a Moving Image Gallery, where film screenings are held. SAM at 8Q at the Singapore Art Museum showcases the works of Singapore contemporary artists.

name: Jamae Mosque (Masjid Chulia) Singapore
description: Also known as Masjid Chulia, Jamae Mosque is one of Singapore’s oldest mosques and a prominent landmark in Chinatown since the 1820s. Jamae Mosque (or Masjid Chulia) is one of Singapore’s oldest mosques and a prominent landmark in Chinatown since the 1820s.

name: Institute of Contemporary Arts Singapore
description: This experimental art space housed in a tertiary arts college will help you deepen your understanding of contemporary art. Housed in a tertiary arts college, the Institute of Contemporary Arts Singapore will help you deepen your appreciation for experimental artworks.
address: LASALLE College of the Arts, 1 McNally Street

name: Singapore Flyer
description: This giant observation wheel offers 360-degree city views, a panorama that stretches to parts of Malaysia and Indonesia on a clear day. The Singapore Flyer not only offers you stunning views of the city, but is one of the city’s most recognisable architectural icons.

name: Marina Bay Sands®
description: A feat of engineering, an architectural statement and a sheer aesthetic triumph, Marina Bay Sands<sup>®</sup> has upped the ante for buildings in Singapore. Superlatives naturally spring to mind when beholding Marina Bay Sands®. Its bold, swooping curves, steep slopes, and soaring spaces defy gravity and evoke awe.

name: Marina Barrage
description: This innovative facility not only supplies water to Singaporeans and helps alleviate floods but also doubles up as a place for family fun. The Marina Barrage not only supplies water to Singaporeans and helps alleviate floods but also doubles up as a place for family fun.

name: Henderson Waves Bridge
description: Lush jungle is broken up with a seriously creative twist in the fantastic form of the Henderson Waves bridge. With the Henderson Waves bridge, form meets function to stunning effect.

name: Labrador Nature Reserve
description: With its rich biodiversity and war relics, nature lovers and history enthusiasts will find plenty to do at Labrador Nature Reserve. With its rich biodiversity and war relics, nature lovers and history enthusiasts will find plenty to do at Labrador Nature Reserve.

name: Marina Bay Singapore: Attractions & Things to do
description: Marina Bay represents all things modern and super-stylish, from trendy dining destinations to exciting leisure spots. Marina Bay represents all things modern and super-stylish in Singapore, from trendy dining destinations to fun leisure spots.

name: Marina Bay Sands, Singapore
description: This iconic integrated resort boasts luxury accommodations, upscale shopping and an infinity pool with unparalleled views of the city. Marina Bay Sands® boasts luxury accommodations, upscale shopping and an infinity pool with unparalleled views of the city.

name: Chek Jawa
description: A world away from shopping malls and glitzy hotels, this natural wonder is one of Singapore’s richest eco-systems. A world away from shopping malls and glitzy hotels, the natural wonder of Chek Jawa is one of Singapore’s richest eco-systems.

name: Merlion Park, Singapore: Attractions & Things to Do
description: Half-fish and half-lion, the iconic Merlion resides at the waterfront Merlion Park. Merlion Park houses a Singapore icon that is half-fish and half-lion, and famous throughout the world.

name: Marina Bay Sands® SkyPark
description: The Marina Bay Sands<sup>®</sup> SkyPark is a roof like no other, perched 200 metres in the air with an infinity pool and observation deck in the clouds. The Marina Bay Sands<sup>®</sup> SkyPark is a roof like no other, perched 200 metres in the air with an infinity pool and observation deck in the clouds.

name: Resorts World Sentosa, Singapore
description: Experience endless excitement at Resorts World Sentosa with a variety of attractions and entertainment hot spots. Whether it’s themes parks, world-class performances or celebrity restaurants, you’ll never run out of things to do at Resorts World™ Sentosa.

name: Singapore Garden & Singapore Park
description: This 10-km stretch of connecting trails lets you walk among the trees to observe a wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat. The Southern Ridges is a 10-km stretch of connecting trails which lets you walk among the trees to observe a wide variety of flora and fauna in their natural habitat.
address: Henderson Road, Mount Faber Park, Telok Blangah Hill Park

name: Sungei Buloh
description: This ecological wonder will transport you into a world rich in animal and plant life. The ecological wonder of Sungei Buloh will transport you into a world rich in animal and plant life.

name: S.E.A. Aquarium
description: Immerse yourself underwater at the S.E.A. Aquarium™ and discover more than 100,000 marine animals. Immerse yourself underwater at the S.E.A. Aquarium™ and take a look into the planet’s largest window to the ocean.

name: Singapore River: History & Culture Tours
description: Get to know historic Singapore River and its famous quays: Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. After all, this is where it all began. Get to know the historic Singapore River and its famous quays: Boat Quay, Clarke Quay and Robertson Quay. This, after all, is where it all began.

name: Joo Chiat/Katong: Singapore Peranakan Neighbourhood
description: Discover Peranakan culture as you stroll past heritage shophouses, quaint stores and eateries in this charming corner of eastern Singapore. Discover Peranakan culture as you stroll past heritage shophouses, quaint stores and eateries in Joo Chiat/Katong, a charming corner of eastern Singapore.

name: Sentosa Island, Singapore: Leisure & Attractions
description: Sentosa Island is Singapore’s favourite leisure destination with exciting attractions, golden beaches, luxe retreats and the country’s first integrated resort. Sentosa Island is Singapore’s favourite leisure destination, with more than 500 hectares filled with exciting attractions, golden beaches, luxe retreats and the country’s first integrated resort, Resorts World Sentosa.

name: Chinatown Singapore: History & Culture
description: Singapore’s historic Chinatown is a bustling mix of old and new, filled with traditional shops and markets as well as cool stores and cafes. Singapore’s legendary Chinatown is a bustling mix of old and new, filled with traditional shops and night markets as well as cool stores and cafes.

name: Buddha Tooth Relic Temple & Museum in Singapore
description: This Tang-styled Chinese Buddhist temple in Chinatown gets its name from what the Buddhists regard as the Sacred Buddha Tooth Relic. The Buddha Tooth Relic Temple & Museum is a Tang-styled Chinese Buddhist temple in Chinatown that gets its name from the Sacred Buddha Tooth Relic.

name: National Gallery Singapore
description: Take in the region’s newest and largest museum of modern Singapore and Southeast Asian art housed within two of Singapore’s awe-inspiring national monuments. Take in the region’s newest and largest museum of modern Singapore and Southeast Asian art housed within two of Singapore’s awe-inspiring national monuments.

name: Universal Studios Singapore™ Theme Park
description: Step into the glamorous world of movies at this world-class theme park located within Resorts World Sentosa™. Universal Studios Singapore™ at Resorts World™ Sentosa is a movie-themed entertainment park that the whole family can enjoy.

name: Singapore Science Centre
description: This enlightening attraction holds the largest collection of educational materials devoted to science in Singapore. Singapore Science Centre holds the largest collection of educational materials devoted to science in the country.

name: Fuk Tak Chi Museum & Places of Interest
description: Fuk Tak Chi Museum was once the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and is an elegant example of restored architecture in Chinatown. Fuk Tak Chi Museum was once the oldest Chinese temple in Singapore and is an elegant example of restored architecture in Chinatown.

name: Katong Antique House Singapore: Peranakan Heritage
description: Step into this fully restored bona fide Peranakan family home, and admire the many antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection. Step into this fully restored bona fide Peranakan family home, and admire the many antiques and heirlooms worthy of any museum collection.

name: Chinese Garden Singapore
description: A tranquil patch of imperial China in the west of Singapore is pleasant respite from the bustle of the city. A tranquil patch of imperial China in the west of Singapore is pleasant respite from the bustle of the city.

name: East Coast Park Singapore
description: With so many attractions packed into this 15-km stretch of beaches, you’ll never run out of things to do. With so many attractions packed into the 15-km stretch of beaches at East Coast Park, you’ll never run out of things to do.
address: Along East Coast Parkway and East Coast Park Service Road

name: Fort Canning Park
description: Whether you’re a history buff, music fan or nature lover, this historic landmark on a hill is full of surprises. Whether you’re a history buff, music fan or nature lover, this historic Fort Canning Park has something for everyone.
address: Bounded by Hill Street, Canning Rise, Clemenceau Avenue and River Valley Road

name: Kusu Island, Singapore
description: If you’re looking for local heritage off the beaten track with a good dash of nature, Kusu Island hits the spot. Kusu Island lies to the south of Singapore, and has a wonderful mix of local heritage and beach activities.

name: Jurong Bird Park, Singapore: Attractions & Things to Do
description: Jurong Bird Park has almost every species to impress avian lovers, along with fun exhibits, interactive shows, and of course, its charming residents. Jurong Bird Park has almost every species to impress avian lovers, along with fun exhibits, interactive shows, and of course, its charming residents.

name: HortPark
description: Lose yourself in this dreamscape of stunning gardens that will make you forget the bustle of city. HortPark is a gorgeous collection of stunning gardens and plants that will make you  forget about the bustle of city.

name: Adventure Cove Waterpark™ Singapore
description: Make a big splash at this aquatic adventure park at Resorts World™ Sentosa. Adventure Cove Waterpark™ Singapore at Resorts World™ Sentosa promises a day of wet and wild fun in the sun.

name: Lasalle College of the Arts
description: How can something that fits so perfectly into a cityscape evoke nature as well? It all lies in the design of Lasalle College of the Arts. How can something that fits so perfectly into a cityscape evoke nature as well? It all lies in the design of Lasalle College of the Arts.
